page.title: 08Poringland's Media/News
page.content: The main source of daily news in Poringland is from Eastern Counties Newspapers, based in Norwich in Eastern Daily Press + Eastern Evening News.No papers are especially published for the village but the local parish magazine contains the general village news it is distributed to every second house. EXAMPLES OF PORINGLAND'S NEWS: In 1952 Poringlands Primary Schools teachers broke up as a unit do to a new Secondary School.In 1966 the Norfolk Council postponed indenfiatly the Provision of mobile classrooms. In 1968 some land fetched Â£8,000 per acre later the land was sold for Â£26,250. A disturbance in Poringland caused by the South Norfolk Planners,who proposed to build on the site of the legendery Oak and Pond made famous by the Norwich painter John Crome.
